snippet: In a surprise decision, a federal appeals court has ruled that Rajat K. Gupta can remain free on bail while he challenges his insider-trading conviction. He was set to start serving a two-year sentence on Jan. 8.
abstract: In a surprise decision, a federal appeals court has ruled that Rajat K. Gupta can remain free on bail while he challenges his insider-trading conviction. He was set to start serving a two-year sentence on Jan. 8.

headline.main: Former Goldman Director Gupta to Stay Free Pending Appeal
headline.print_headline: Trading Insider to Remain Free on Bail
